problem_text:
(J. G. Thompson). For a finite group G and natural number n, set G(n) = {x ∈ G | x^n = 1} and define the type of G to be the function whose value at n is the order of G(n). Is it true that a group is soluble if its type is the same as that of a soluble one?
A. S. Kondratiev, W. J. Shi
answer: No, not always (P. Piwek, Algebra Number Theory, 19, no. 8 (2025), 1663–1670).
